can you install office 2013 from office 2007?
Or do I have to uninstall 2007 first?

Thanks for up!
2007, geez. Yes I would definitely recommend fully uninstalling any previous versions of office before using 2013.

@murphy78 nice up :)
As for the office 2007 i am unsure, but i had a guy comment on one of my torrents that he was successful in updating from office 2010..hope this  helps :)

Yah they can co-exist, but activators sometimes don't support the way they detect them co-existing. For example, codyqx4's toolkit doesn't detect office 2010 sometimes if you have 2013 installed. I think it has something to do with either their registry keys or setup info that is in the registry.
does it work for 32 bit Win 7 ? or must i download both x86 and x64
No problem installing 2013 when you have 2007. Start the setup and select the upgrade button :)
Is this the full activation version?
I installed it, and I'm confused on how to open it and actually use microsoft word through office, I can't seem to find the file ?? help asap !

delleonb, office 2013 puts shortcuts for everything on your start menu. You can copy them wherever you want. If you use win8, you can right click them and open location, then open desktop and copy the lnk files for the progs you want. For win7 you could prolly just right click and drag them from the start menu.

recon, read my notes about activation in the description. You have to use a kms activator. There is no retail office activation and never will be unless you buy it.

cselva007, no. You should use 32-bit version on a 32-bit OS and 64-bit on a 64-bit OS. You could technically use a 32-bit version on a 64-bit OS, but there's not really any speed increase, so there's no reason to.
